paragraphs.text: What is a magical and invisible action that I have done to make these pixels right?
paragraphs.name: 8c99

paragraphs.text: With each newly added text layer, you may notice that line height is not good for reading. We have to count each time a formula — text size * 1.5 = good text size. For example: 14px * 1.5 = 21px.
paragraphs.name: b3bf

paragraphs.text: The reason for using it — each time when you hold “Shift” and move artboards by mouse they move only vertically or horizontally. It helps to move things in strong order.
paragraphs.name: 72aa

paragraphs.text: Solution: Select artboards, click and keep a mouse on artboard name (like on a screenshot below), press and hold “Shift”. Move a mouse — it works
paragraphs.name: 79ee
20d3
paragraphs.text:
Send a comment you know how to fix it, dear friend. 
Not solved yet.

paragraphs.name: a5b5

paragraphs.text: Use 1 px rectangle. It works good and predictable. And with that hotkey you always can get rid of half-pixels
paragraphs.name: f6be

paragraphs.text: Select the artboards
paragraphs.name: e794

paragraphs.text: Release the SHIFT key
paragraphs.name: 1fc4

paragraphs.text: Click and hold on the name of one of the artboards
paragraphs.name: 050c

paragraphs.text: Drag them around ;)

virtuals.subtitle: If you draw 1px thick line you just can’t change it’s position to “inside” or “outside” — it’s always centered.

content.subtitle: If you draw 1px thick line you just can’t change it’s position to “inside” or “outside” — it’s always centered.

6a0d3313abd.title: You can also just add a percentage amount, so for your example add “150%” in the line-height input…

paragraphs.text: You can also just add a percentage amount, so for your example add “150%” in the line-height input and it will convert to 21px
paragraphs.name: 772b

4b425a119595.title: This can sort of be archived using icon symbol with masking element (color mixin).

paragraphs.name: a9c1

paragraphs.text: Good, quick read here. My biggest problem with Sketch is the size of pdf exports. I would like to be able to export all my artboards to a single e-mailable pdf.
In illustrator, you can tweak settings for compression, illustrator editability, etc. when exporting to keep file sizes small. Is there a similar way in Sketch?
paragraphs.name: 1d39

virtuals.subtitle: In illustrator, you can tweak settings for compression, illustrator editability, etc. when exporting to keep file sizes small. Is there a…

content.subtitle: In illustrator, you can tweak settings for compression, illustrator editability, etc. when exporting to keep file sizes small. Is there a…

6dabb43bcaa8.title: I think you should try “command+option key+c” to copy a particular style and then select the group…

paragraphs.text: I think you should try “command+option key+c” to copy a particular style and then select the group or a single SVG element to where you want the same style to apply & then press “command+option key+v”.
paragraphs.name: 02b2

paragraphs.text: Hope It’s the same thing you asking for!
